title: How to Make a Candy Cane Reindeer

steps.headline: Plug in the glue gun.
steps.description: Insert one glue stick. Check the glue gun is hot enough so that when you squeeze the trigger liquid glue comes out of the end.

steps.headline: Take out a candy cane, but leave the cellophane wrapper on.
Put one small dot of glue on the short end tip of the candy cane.
Quickly place the puffball on the glue dot.
Take out two googly eyes.
steps.description: Place two small dots of hot glue side-by-side, horizontally, half-way up the short side of the candy cane.

steps.headline: Quickly place one googly eye on each of the glue dots.
Cut one pipe cleaner in half.
Use one half of the pipe cleaner to twist around the curve in the candy cane, leaving equal lengths on both sides of the twist.
Take one of the lengths of the pipe cleaner wrapped around the curve in the candy cane and bend it at the twist so that it makes a 90 degree angle.
steps.description: Bend the pipe cleaner so that it faces away from the candy cane.

steps.headline: Bend the pipe cleaner in a 90 degree angle again, this time about halfway between the first bend and the end of the pipe cleaner.
steps.description: Bend the pipe cleaner so that it faces up.

steps.headline: Repeat the previous two steps with the other length of the pipe cleaner.
Marvel at your tiny, candy cane reindeer!
steps.description: Using the curve of the candy cane, hang it from a Christmas tree branch or wreath.

Bend the pipe cleaner so that it faces up. Repeat the previous two steps with the other length of the pipe cleaner.  Marvel at your tiny, candy cane reindeer! Using the curve of the candy cane, hang it from a Christmas tree branch or wreath.
